english: rise; get up; start to; begin to

etymology.description: 起 ‘rise; set in motion’ + 来 ‘come; toward; inchoative marker’ = ‘get up; start to V; come up.’
etymology.interpretation: Combines rising with motion toward the speaker, yielding literal ‘get up’ and an inchoative use (V-起来) meaning ‘start to/gradually become.’ Also marks a gathered perspective in set phrases like 看起来/说起来.
etymology.simplification: 來 was simplified to 来 by reducing strokes for ease of writing; 起 is unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我早上六点起来(我早上六點起來)。
examples.english: I get up at six in the morning.

examples.chinese: 天气冷起来了(天氣冷起來了)。
看起来他很累(看起來他很累)。
examples.english: It looks like he is very tired.
